review: We have two Roku boxes, one Google Chromecast, and the Amazon Fire TV Stick.  With three TVs in the house, we had one of each type plugged into a television. The Roku and Chromecast are both more reliable overall and easier to use. I have found that the Fire Stick is frustrating to operate having the tendency to not follow the commands.  It seems to get stuck so perhaps the remote control is just faulty, however, it has been doing this since the day we got it in the mail. I click the scroll right arrow once, and it starts scrolling nonstop as though it is stuck.  This happened constantly with it.  The layout isn't the best either. It is clunky and not the best layout for ease of use by the viewer. I found watching tv to be a frustrating experience with this device.If I had to rate all three devices I would rate the Roku first for its easy of use, remote control, and layout.  I would rate the Chromecast second because it doesn't come with a separate remote. Your cell phone or tablet serves as a remote to control it.  I would put the Fire Stick last. The interface is clunky and it is riddled with issues right now that just don't make it as user friendly as the other devices.Of course, this is their first attempt so I assume many of these issues will be addressed in their next version of the device. In the meantime, our TVs will stick with Roku and Chromecast.
